descendants.content: Balancing the scales would be nice. But reversing the ratio would be even better!

account.note:
🌏 Born at 312 PPM

Retired NGO executive doing my best to stay informed and raise awareness about environmental crises, climate breakdown, and the rapacious, murderous impact of greedy capitalists and the politicians they own.

Why the name? Back in the day, empires placated their citizens with "bread and circuses." Now we get fast food and apps. But it's all basically the same — distraction from what's REALLY happening.

descendants.content:
@breadandcircuses Surely.

The funny part is option A wouldn’t need nearly as much to yield great benefit. Option B is that expensive because of the “profit” made along the way, of each link in the supply chain. That’s the illusion of the economic order, that its choices are efficient (and of course do anything like maximizing “good”).

Those supply chains exist because they’ve found a way to pour oil, people etc on them and get money out. It’s intrinsically wasteful.

descendants.content: @breadandcircuses Notice that we use the same language for "fixing" nature as when we fix a car. We apply the words problem and solution onto a living being, Earth, as if tin was just an unliving object. In our language, we do not treat Earth as someone who deserves to be taken care of, to be nurtured. In our language, Earth is just an object that doesnt notice our actions. That doesnt feel or care about our transgressions or neglect. #degrowth

account.note:
Heal Earth🌍

Embrace colife, cohold, degrip, upgrow and allmen :humanarchist:

fields.name: 𐑐𐑮𐑴𐑯𐑬𐑯𐑟
fields.value: 𐑑𐑰/𐑑𐑦𐑯, 𐑒𐑪𐑥/𐑒𐑦𐑥, 𐑣𐑩𐑯/𐑣𐑦𐑯, 𐑣𐑰/𐑣𐑦𐑥

descendants.content:
@breadandcircuses We need to stop using words like problem and solution to talk about Earth. Because Earth deserves better.

Earth is a sick planet that needs to be taken care of. We need treatments, not solutions. We need to talk about conditions, unwellnesses and sickness, not problems.

Talk about Earth as if it lives, because tin does.

Say no to solutionism! Earth is sick🌍

descendants.content:
@vegafjord @breadandcircuses
...Which is exactly why humanity is sleep-walking toward its own arguably deserved destruction.

@clintruin But the treatment is simple. We just need swap out the word "solution" with "treatment" and "problem“ with "condition".

This is all that is needed for change of standing. Because this alone makes us rethink everything.

descendants.content:
@vegafjord
Essentially what you're talking about is the importance of language in forming how we think. This is completely correct of course. Some have even suggested language is a symbiotic virus...but I digress. Rest assured the Powers That Be are quite familiar with these concepts, and have employed them against the concept you're discussing.

If not read, may I suggest Noam Chomsky's "Necessary Illusions: Thought Control in Democratic Societies."
https://www.amazon.com/Necessary-Illusions-Thought-Democratic-Societies/dp/0887845746

@breadandcircuses

As of early 2024, the top 10 wealthiest people in the world were Bernard Arnault, Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, Larry Ellison, Warren Buffett, Bill Gates, Michael Bloomberg, Carlos Slim Helu, Mukesh Ambani and Steve Ballmer.
Their #wealth at that time was $1.1736 trillion dollars.

card.description:
Bloomberg Hundred Billion+
These are the worlds 100+ #billionaires according to #Bloomberg:

#1: Elon Musk - $239B (+$10.2B)  - USA/Tech

#2: Jeff Bezos - $200B (+$23.6B)  - USA/Tech

#3: Mark Zuckerberg - $191B (+$62.6B)  - USA/Tech

#4: Bernard Arnault - $190B (-$17.3B)  - France/Consumer

#5: Bill Gates - $157B (+$15.9B)  - USA/Tech

#6: Larry Ellison - $151B (+$28.3B)  - USA/Tech

#7: Steve Ballmer - $146B (+$15.0B)  - USA/Tech

#8: Larry Page - $146B (+$19.1B)  - USA/Tech

#9: Warren Buffett - $139B (+$19.2B)  - USA/Diversified

#10: Sergey Brin - $137B (+$17.1B)  - USA/Tech

#11: Mukesh Ambani - $110B (+$13.5B)  - India/Energy

#12: Jensen Huang - $108B (+$63.7B)  - USA/Tech

#13: Michael Dell - $105B (+$27.0B)  - USA/Tech

#14: Gautam Adani - $102B (+$18.1B)  - India/Industrial

#15: Amancio Ortega - $99.2B (+$11.8B)  - Spain/Retail

Full List:  https://www.bloomberg.com/billionaires

#noOligarchy #noBillionaires #billionsbot
